channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Goldman Sachs Got Lax on Credit Cards. The Bill Is Coming Due.
item.description: The bank lent loosely on some credit cards, contributing to a big loss as it tries to sell the General Motors card business.

item.title: Tesla’s stock deserves a ‘unique’ valuation, according to the newest bull
item.description: Tesla shares rank among the leading S&P 500 gainers Tuesday after a bullish Deutsche Bank initiation.

item.title: Fed Backpedals on Plan to Increase Big Bank Capital
item.description: Banks spent over a year fighting earlier proposals that would have raised some banks’ capital buffers by nearly 20%.

item.title: Goldman Sachs CEO says bond and currency trading is down 10% in the current quarter from a year ago
item.description: JPMorgan stock also falls on drop in activity in the current quarter, mostly due to weak bond trading.

item.title: An Ugly Picture Emerges for Cosmetics Makers in China
item.description: Sales are plunging, sending an economic warning signal in what was once their most important market.

item.title: Oil futures fall to fresh lows for the year after disappointing China data
item.description: Oil futures fell Tuesday, with concerns about demand from China back in focus after another round of lackluster economic data.

item.title: It's the Airplane of the Future. It's Still Grounded.
item.description: Engine problems are the latest chapter in the troubled history of the Airbus A220, a jet that has the potential to revolutionize regional and short-ha...

item.title: Apple owes €13 billion in back taxes as long-running dispute ends
item.description: The European Court of Justice on Tuesday ruled that Apple owed €13 billion ($14.3 billion) in back taxes over what it said was illegal state aid from ...

item.title: The Shadow Dollar That's Fueling the Financial Underworld
item.description: The cryptocurrency tether enables a parallel economy that operates beyond the reach of U.S. law enforcement.

item.title: Meta is one of the cheapest big tech stocks, and that earns it a new ‘buy’ call
item.description: Meta is poised to be an open-source leader for the next two major tech platforms, say analysts.
